comments: Least k >= 2 such that sigma(n) divides sigma(n*k), where sigma is A000203 - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 01 2002Contains all and only the prime powers p^k, k>0. The first occurrence of p^k is at A003418(p^k-1); so new records occur at indices in A051451. - Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Jun 13 2011.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= proc(n) local k;for k from 2 while n mod k = 0 do od:kend proc:seq(a(n),n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Sep 02 2014
mathematica: Table[k := 1; While[Mod[n, k] == 0, k++]; k, {n, 1, 2000}]  (* _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 16 2012 *)
author: _Jeffrey Shallit_
